articles.author: Matt Stevens
articles.title: Corey Lewandowski Says He Won’t Run for New Hampshire Senate Seat
articles.description: President Trump’s former campaign manager had been weighing a run but said he would focus on Mr. Trump’s re-election instead.
articles.content: Corey Lewandowski, the political operative who was President Trumps first 2016 campaign manager, said Tuesday that he would not seek a United States Senate seat in New Hampshire, ending months of speculation about a run that would have tested the Granite Stat… [+405 chars]

articles.author: Natalie Pita
articles.title: Over a Year After Hurricane, ‘Recovery Is a Long Process’
articles.description: Florence ravaged parts of North Carolina in September 2018, leaving many food sources insecure. Dedicated volunteers help fill the gaps at a pantry.
articles.content: The food bank is one of the states many efforts to address the impact Hurricane Florence has had. This pantry is an outgrowth of the one organized through Bryant Chapel A.M.E. Zion Church in Cove City, N.C., which expanded after the hurricane and received a g… [+1170 chars]

articles.title: 2nd Senate Republican Questions Impartiality of Impeachment Trial - The New York Times
articles.description: Senator Susan Collins of Maine joined Lisa Murkowski in raising concerns over her leaders’ approach, and said she would be “open” to calling witnesses.
articles.content: WASHINGTON  Senator Susan Collins, Republican of Maine, criticized some of her Senate colleagues, including the majority leader, for appearing to prejudge the evidence in impeachment proceedings against President Trump, becoming the second Republican senator … [+1351 chars]

articles.author: Nitsuh Abebe
articles.title: Why the Most Ridiculous Part of ‘The Irishman’ Actually Works
articles.description: The digital effects were mocked for trying to make an old man young. But this is the rare American film that accepts what being old really means.
articles.content: But that mockery deserves its full context, too. Consider our nation: The president is in his 70s, as are his three leading challengers, as well as the Senate majority leader and the speaker of the House. Its estimated that nearly one-quarter of the 2020 elec… [+2567 chars]

articles.author: Alan Rappeport
articles.title: Trump Says U.S. and China Will Sign Trade Deal in January
articles.description: President Trump said the signing ceremony would be held at the White House and that he would travel to Beijing to continue discussions about a Phase 2 deal.
